document.masterDocTitle: New species of the Afrotropical spider genus Cheiramiona Lotz & Dippenaar- Schoeman (Araneae: Eutichuridae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New species of the Afrotropical spider genus Cheiramiona Lotz & Dippenaar- Schoeman (Araneae: Eutichuridae)

Etymology . The specific name is an adjective taken from the type locality.

FIGURES 13–24. 13–15
Cheiramiona hlathikulu
sp . nov .
: 13 male cheliceral teeth, apical view; 14 male palp, ventral view; 15 same retrolateral view. 16–21
C. hogsbackensis
sp . nov .
: 16 female cheliceral teeth, apical view; 17 epigynum, ventral view; 18 same, dorsal view; 19 male cheliceral teeth, apical view; 20 male palp, ventral view; 21 same, retrolateral view. 22–24
C. ibayaensis
sp . nov .
: 22 male cheliceral teeth; 23 male palp, ventral view; 24 same, retrolateral view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Description . Female (n = 4 ): TL = 4.13 ( 3.6–4.5 ); CL = 1.90 ( 1.4–2.2 ); CW = 1.48 ( 1.1–1.7 ); OAL = 0.31 ( 0.25–0.35 ); OAW = 0.98 ( 0.70–1.15 ); CLL = 0.05 ( 0.05 – 0.05 ). Chelicerae: robust with long fangs; PMT:RMT = 4 : 5 (
Fig. 16
). Measurements: AME–AME 0.10 ; AME–ALE 0.20 ; AME diameter 0.15 ; PME–PME 0.20 ; PME– PLE 0.25 ; PME diameter 0.15 ; MOQAW 0.40 ; MOQPW 0.50 ; CI (CL/CW) 1.29 ; LL:CL 2.77 ; STL 1.1 ; STW 1.0. Leg measurements: I— 1.6 + 0.8 + 1.4 + 1.6 + 0.7 = 6.1 ; II— 1.3 + 0.7 +1.0+ 1.2 + 0.6 = 4.8 ; III— 1.1 + 0.6 + 0.8 +1.0+ 0.5 = 4.0; IV— 1.3 + 0.8 + 1.4 + 1.6 + 0.6 = 5.7 ; Palp— 0.8 + 0.4 + 0.5 + 0.8 = 2.5 . Leg spines: I—0, 0, 0-
0- 1
v; II—0, 0, 0-
0- 1
v; III—0, 0, 0- 0-3
v 1
p 1 r; IV—0, 0, 0-1 v- 3
v 1
p 1 r. Abdomen: creamy-yellow with pale heart mark and chevron markings posterior of heart mark. Epigynum (
Figs 17–18
): wider than long, with long, recurved depression in posterior half; copulatory openings situated laterally in depression, near epigastric fold; epigastric fold forming slight lip-like extension; internally, short copulatory ducts with single loop proceed anterially before ending posteriorly in SPER ; fertilization tubes enter SPER posterior-laterally.

Male (n = 5 ): TL = 3.78 ( 2.9–4.3 ); CL = 1.86 ( 1.6–2.1 ); CW = 1.43 ( 1.20–1.55 ); OAL = 0.29 ( 0.25–0.30 ); OAW = 0.85 ( 0.7–0.9 ); CLL = 0.05 ( 0.05 – 0.05 ). Chelicerae: robust with long fangs; PMT:RMT = 4 : 4 (
Fig. 19
). Measurements: AME–AME 0.15 ; AME–ALE 0.15 ; AME diameter 0.10 ; PME–PME 0.20 ; PME–PLE 0.20 ; PME diameter 0.10 ; MOQAW 0.35 ; MOQPW 0.40 ; CI (CL/CW) 1.36 ; LL:CL 2.95 ; STL 1.0; STW 0.9 . Leg measurements: I— 1.6 + 0.8 + 1.5 + 1.6 + 0.7 = 6.2 ; II— 1.2 + 0.6 +1.0+ 1.1 + 0.5 = 4.4 ; III—1.0+ 0.5 + 0.7 + 0.9 + 0.4 = 3.5 ; IV— 1.5 + 0.7 + 1.2 + 1.3 + 0.5 = 5.2 ; Palp— 0.8 + 0.3 + 0.3 + 0.8 = 2.2 . Leg spines: I—0, 0, 0-
0- 1
v; II—0, 0, 0-
0- 1
v; III— 0, 0, 0- 0-3
v 1
p 1 r; IV—0, 0, 0-1 p 1 r- 3
v 1
p 1 r. Abdomen: similar to female. Palp (
Figs 20–21
): cymbium elongate, longer than patella plus tibia length; tibia with broad RTA with bifid tip, with line of small denticles on inner margin and point near dorsal side; TA slightly sclerotized, curved towards EM at tip; EM short, thick, with narrower pointed apex, apex slightly separated from main body of EM; CON finger-like, distinct but not sclerotized.
Habitat . Collected at base of grass tussocks and in leaf litter from forests and plantations.
